channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-4603] test testBuiltinAuthenticationWithConfigurableHash fails from upgradeTests.Changes10_6 with ibm's j9
item.description:
With the patch for DERBY-4602 I saw one error with IBM's weme 6.2:

1) testBuiltinAuthenticationWithConfigurableHash(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.Changes10_6)java.sql.SQLException: The message digest algorithm 'SHA-256' is not supported by any of the available cryptography providers. Please install a cryptography provider that supports that algorithm, or specify another algorithm in the derby.authentication.builtin.algorithm property.

at org.apache.derby.impl.jdbc.Util.newEmbedSQLException(Util.java:142)

item.summary: test testBuiltinAuthenticationWithConfigurableHash fails from upgradeTests.Changes10_6 with ibm's j9

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The failing upgrade test case explicitly sets the hash algorithm to SHA-256, but for the test it doesn't really matter which algorithm is used, as long as it's not null. The attached patch makes the test use SHA-1 instead, so that it also passes on platforms without built-in support for SHA-256.
